trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a compiler error occurs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCompileException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCompileException"></xref> class.
The exception message to specify when the error occurs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCompileException"></xref> class.
For the `sourceCode` parameter, you can pass any string information that is descriptive to the error condition; there are no checks on file or path.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpCompileException.SourceCode%2A> property returns the string that was passed as the parameter value.
If you use a constructor that does not require the `sourceCode` parameter, the <xref:System.Web.HttpCompileException.SourceCode%2A> property is `null`.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerResults"></xref> containing compiler output and error information.
The path to the file that contains the source code being compiled when the error occurs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCompileException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If `innerException` is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
Sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with information about the exception.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets a message that describes the reason for the current exception.
A string that describes the first compilation error listed in the compiler results.
If no compiler results were provided, the property returns the error message provided for this exception, or an empty string (""), if no error message was provided.
Gets compiler output and error information for the exception.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerResults"></xref> containing compiler output and error information.
Gets a string containing the path to the file that contains the source code being compiled when the error occurs.
The path of the source file being compiled when the error occurs.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
